protocols.title: Minor Cuts & Grazes
steps: Wash your hands before touching the wound.
Clean the wound with clean water or an antiseptic wipe.
Pat the area dry with a clean tissue/gauze (do not rub).
Apply a sterile adhesive dressing (plaster).

protocols.title: Nosebleed
steps: Sit the student down.
Tilt head FORWARD (looking at lap). NOT back.
Pinch the soft part of the nose just below the bone.
Have them breathe through their mouth.
Hold pinch for 10 minutes.

protocols.title: Insect Bites & Stings
steps: Remove the sting if visible (scrape it out, don't squeeze).
Wash the area with soap and water.
Apply a cold compress (ice pack wrapped in cloth) for 10 mins.
Monitor for allergic reaction.

protocols.title: Burns & Scalds
steps: Move away from the heat source.
Run COOL/TEPID running water over the burn for 20 minutes immediately.
Remove jewelry/clothing near burn (unless stuck to skin).
Cover with cling film or sterile non-fluffy dressing.

protocols.title: Choking
steps: Ask: 'Are you choking?'
If they can cough, encourage coughing.
If silent: Give 5 Back Blows (between shoulder blades).
If no success: Give 5 Abdominal Thrusts (pull in and up above navel).
Repeat cycle.

protocols.title: Fainting
steps: Lay the person flat on their back.
Raise legs above heart level (approx 30cm).
Loosen tight clothing (collar, belt).
Ensure fresh air supply.
red_flags: Not waking up > 2 mins -> Recovery Position & Call 112

protocols.title: Head Injury (Concussion)
steps: Sit them down and apply a cold compress to the bump.
Monitor for signs of concussion: dizziness, vomiting, confusion.
Do not let them return to sport/play.

protocols.title: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation)
steps: DANGER: Check area safety.
RESPONSE: Shake shoulders, shout 'Hello?'
AIRWAY: Tilt head back.
BREATHING: Look, listen, feel for 10s. If NOT breathing normally...
CALL 112/Ambulance.
COMPRESSIONS: Center of chest, interlocked hands. Push hard and fast (2 per second). Depth 5-6cm.
BREATHS: 30 compressions then 2 rescue breaths (if trained). Otherwise Hands-Only.
Continue until help arrives.
red_flags: Do not stop until paramedic takes over

protocols.title: Bone Fractures
steps: Support the injury with hand or sling.
Immobilize the area (do not try to straighten).
Cover open wounds with sterile dressing.
Transport to hospital.

protocols.title: Seizures
steps: Protect head with cushion/coat.
Remove dangerous objects nearby.
Note the time the seizure starts.
Do NOT restrain.
Do NOT put anything in mouth.
After shaking stops, place in Recovery Position.

protocols.title: Severe Allergic Reaction (Anaphylaxis)
steps: Lay victim smooth. If breathing is difficult, allow to sit.
Administer Adrenaline Auto-Injector (EpiPen) immediately if available.
Call 112 immediately tailored for 'Anaphylaxis'.
If no improvement in 5 mins, give second dose.
